steps.title: Wash your armpits with a gentle cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your armpits with a gentle cleanser. Practicing generally good hygiene can help clear existing breakouts and prevent future ones. Wash your armpits with a gentle non-abrasive cleanser when you bathe to keep the area clean and free of sweat. [2] X Research source [v161902_b01]. 19 July 2021. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Try not to scrub your armpits or rub hard. This could irritate the pimples and make them worse. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Cleansers can also relieve discomfort, speed up healing, and prevent flare-ups. [5] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Try an antiseptic wash to clean your skin if regular soap doesn’t help.
steps.content: Try an antiseptic wash to clean your skin if regular soap doesn’t help. If HS is causing your bumps and sores, then a stronger cleaner might work better. Try applying an antiseptic wash like 4% chlorhexidine daily alongside other treatments to treat HS. [6] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Antiseptics like chlorhexidine might be a little harsh on your skin if you aren’t used to them. Start by using it once a week to make sure it doesn’t irritate your skin, then increase your use to once daily. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you need a recommendation for a good antiseptic cleanser, ask your dermatologist for the best options.

steps.title: Avoid fragranced soaps or deodorants.
steps.content: Avoid fragranced soaps or deodorants. Fragrances and perfumes can irritate your skin and might trigger HS breakouts. It’s best to use soaps and deodorants that don’t contain alcohol, baking soda, parabens, dyes, or fragrances. This might help prevent more irritation and flare-ups. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Make sure all the products you use are labeled “Fragrance-free.” If your acne is due to contact dermatitis, look for hypoallergenic products designed for sensitive skin to reduce irritation. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Reader Poll: We asked 331 wikiHow readers if they use deodorant, and 79% of them said yes. [Take Poll] So, check to see if your deodorant is fragrance-free.

steps.title: Try not to use a washcloth or loofah in your armpits.
steps.content: Try not to use a washcloth or loofah in your armpits. You might be tempted to scrub your armpits hard to keep them as clean as possible, but this is a mistake! Scrubbing the area with washcloths, loofahs, sponges, or other items can irritate the skin. [10] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Just use your fingertips and a gentle cleanser to wash your armpits. [11] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source This can keep the area plenty clean. Loofahs, washcloths, and synthetic sponges can also harbor and breed bacteria, which could cause infections. [12] X Trustworthy Source Go Ask Alice Medical advice site with content written by health promotion specialists affiliated with Columbia University Go to source

steps.title: Apply antifungal powder, ointment, or cream if you have a yeast infection.
steps.content: Apply antifungal powder , ointment, or cream if you have a yeast infection. If the pimples under your armpit are from a yeast infection, your dermatologist may prescribe an antifungal medication. Your health care provider might recommend a cream, ointment, powder, or in some cases, an oral medication. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Keep your underarms clean and dry as part of the treatment. Expose your armpits to air or use a drying powder or topical antiperspirant to dry out your skin and prevent future infections. [14] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Wear loose-fitting clothes to prevent friction in your armpits.
steps.content: Wear loose-fitting clothes to prevent friction in your armpits. Tight clothes can irritate your skin, which can trigger more breakouts. If your HS flares up when wearing tight clothes, try wearing looser shirts that don’t rub on your armpits to see if this helps. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you often get pimples in other places like your back, then wearing loose-fitting clothes that don’t rub on these spots can also help. [16] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: If you shave, use antibacterial soap and a gel-to-foam shaving gel.
steps.content: If you shave, use antibacterial soap and a gel-to-foam shaving gel . If you shave, take extra precautions to avoid nicks and cuts, which can cause a new HS sore or infection. Before you shave, wash the area with an antibacterial soap, then apply a gel-to-foam shaving gel. Shave carefully around your HS sores. Dermatologists recommend never to wax your armpits because you could irritate the skin, which may cause more HS. [17] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you want to get rid of armpit hair, talk to your dermatologist about laser hair removal. [18] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Avoid razor bumps by shaving with a sharp razor and using proper shaving cream. [19] X Research source [v161902_b01]. 19 July 2021.

steps.title: Hold a warm compress on the pimples.
steps.content: Hold a warm compress on the pimples. Place a clean washcloth under warm running water. Wring out the extra water and make sure it’s cool enough to press onto your skin without any pain. Then hold it onto your armpit pimples for 10 minutes at a time and repeat several times throughout the day to relieve pain. [20] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Always test the washcloth to make sure it’s cool enough first so you don’t get burned.

steps.title: Try using a black tea bag to reduce pain.
steps.content: Try using a black tea bag to reduce pain. This sounds weird, but it might be an effective home remedy for treating pain from pimples. Boil some water, then steep a teabag of black tea in the water for 10 minutes. Place a clean cloth or gauze in a clean container and pour the tea over the cloth. Wring out the excess liquid and press the cloth against your pimples for 10 minutes. [21] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Repeat several times as needed to reduce the pain. [22] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Make sure the teabag is cool before pressing it onto your skin. Otherwise, you could get burned.

steps.title: Take pain relievers if you’re very uncomfortable.
steps.content: Take pain relievers if you’re very uncomfortable. Pimples in your armpit can be painful and home remedies might not do the trick for you. This is okay, and you can take care of the pain with some over-the-counter pain relievers. [23] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Take all pain medication according to the product instructions so you don’t use too much. OTC pain relievers might be enough for most people, but if you’re in a lot of pain, your healthcare provider might be able to prescribe something stronger or refer you to a pain clinic. [24] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Wash your armpits with acne soap.
steps.content: Wash your armpits with acne soap . Acne soap isn’t just for your face. Specialized acne soaps are designed to clear pimples and prevent new breakouts. When you visit your dermatologist, they may recommend using acne soap in your armpits. Replace your normal soap with acne cleansers like benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid to see if it helps clear your pimples. [25] X Trustworthy Source FamilyDoctor.org Family-focused medical advice site run by the American Academy of Family Doctors Go to source Some acne soaps are available over the counter, and some need a prescription. [26] X Trustworthy Source FamilyDoctor.org Family-focused medical advice site run by the American Academy of Family Doctors Go to source Use the one that your dermatologist recommends.

steps.title: Fight the infection with antibiotic creams.
steps.content: Fight the infection with antibiotic creams. This is a common treatment for acne and HS, and your dermatologist might prescribe it to manage your symptoms. Antibiotic gels or liquids can reduce inflammation and get rid of the bacteria that might cause more breakouts. Apply this liquid or gel according to your dermatologist’s instructions to help your skin heal. [27] X Research source [v161902_b01]. 19 July 2021. [28] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Common topical antibiotics include clindamycin and erythromycin. [29] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Your dermatologist might prescribe one of these or a different one. For more serious cases, your doctor may also try prescribing oral antibiotics to fight the infection. Check with your doctor to make sure no underlying diseases are causing your pimples (like hidradenitis suppurativa). [30] X Research source [v161902_b01]. 19 July 2021.

steps.title: Take retinoids or steroid medications to control inflammation.
steps.content: Take retinoids or steroid medications to control inflammation. For more serious cases of HS, your dermatologist may prescribe retinoids or corticosteroids (topical steroid creams). These medications can reduce swelling and inflammation and could help treat breakouts. [31] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Steroid medications can be taken as tablets, topical creams, or injections. [32] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source

steps.title: Fix damage from HS with minor surgical procedures.
steps.content: Fix damage from HS with minor surgical procedures. In rare cases, severe HS could cause scarring or tunneling in your skin. This sounds bad, but the problem is fixable. If you do have skin damage from repeated HS breakouts, talk to a dermatologist. They might recommend one of the following treatments to heal your skin. [33] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Unroofing is a procedure that exposes the tunnels under your skin. It can help with moderate to severe HS cases. There are also limited unroofing procedures for single nodules or cysts. Individual cysts or growths can be surgically removed in a simple punch debridement procedure. Laser therapy could help make nodules or lesions go away, especially in early HS stages. After this treatment, sores are unlikely to return. For very severe cases, the dermatologist may remove all of the infected skin and perform a skin graft to close the area.

steps.title: Lose weight
steps.content: Lose weight to prevent HS breakouts. For overweight patients, losing weight can reduce flare-ups and prevent HS from worsening. Try following a diet and exercise routine to get down to a healthy weight. In some studies, people with HS saw their HS go away after they lost weight. [34] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you start an exercise regimen, remember to shower as soon as possible when you’re done! Sweating and overheating can worsen HS. [35] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you aren’t sure what a healthy body weight is for you, talk to your doctor to come up with a weight-loss plan.

steps.title: Quit smoking or don’t start in the first place.
steps.content: Quit smoking or don’t start in the first place. Quitting smoking can reduce HS flare-ups and prevent your condition from worsening. If you smoke, quitting as soon as possible can be the best choice. If you don’t smoke, then try to avoid starting at all. [36] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Besides HS, smoking can also cause cancer, heart disease, stroke, lung diseases, diabetes, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). [37] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source

steps.title: Follow a healthy diet.
steps.content: Follow a healthy diet. It’s possible that your diet could be causing your HS breakouts as well. High amounts of dairy, red meat, and sugary foods with a high glycemic index (GI) might put you at a higher risk for breakouts. Try limiting these foods in your diet. [38] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source A diet with low-GI foods and less dairy might help prevent acne in other places as well. However, using acne-friendly skin care and medication is proven to help prevent breakouts. [39] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Reduce stress to prevent breakouts.
steps.content: Reduce stress to prevent breakouts. If you have HS, stress could make your condition worse. [40] X Trustworthy Source FamilyDoctor.org Family-focused medical advice site run by the American Academy of Family Doctors Go to source Stress is also linked to acne breakouts. [41] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source If you often feel stressed out, then taking some steps to reduce it can be a big help. Relaxation exercises like meditation, yoga, or deep breathing can release stress and anxiety. [42] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Make time each day for one of these activities. Doing things you enjoy is also a great way to reduce stress, so remember to leave time for your hobbies as well. [43] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source
